de.szut.dqi12.cheftrainer.server.databasecommunication

Class PlayerManagement

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.szut.dqi12.cheftrainer.server.databasecommunication.PlayerManagement

  • public class PlayerManagement
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to Initialize the Database, when the server starts the first time.
    Author:
    Alexander Brennecke

    • Constructor Detail

      • PlayerManagement

        public PlayerManagement(SQLConnection sqlCon)
        Constructor
        Parameters:

    • Method Detail

      • loadRealPlayers

        public void loadRealPlayers(java.lang.String leagueName,
                            java.lang.String leagueCountry)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        This method tries to collect Player. It uses the PlayerParser and TeamParser to fetch these players from different websides. Later it will call another function to write the collected players inside the database.
        Parameters:
        leagueName - the name of the league. Should be "Bundesliga" at the moment.
        leagueCountry - the country of the league. Should be "Deutschland" at the moment.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • addPlayer

        public void addPlayer(Player p,
                      int teamID)
        This method creates a SQLQuerry out of the given Player and sends it to the database.
        Parameters:
        p - the Player that should be send to the database.
        teamID - the id of the RealTeam, in which this player plays.

      • addPlayerToManager

        public void addPlayerToManager(int managerID,
                               int playerID,
                               boolean plays)
        This method creates a sqlQuery and sends it to the database. The query will attache the Player, with the given ID, to the Manager, with the given Id.
        Parameters:
        managerID - the ID of the Manager, that should own the Player;
        playerID - the ID of the Player, that should be owned by the Manager;
        plays - true = player is in the formation, false = he is not.

      • setManagersFormation

        public void setManagersFormation(int managerID,
                                 int defenders,
                                 int middfielders,
                                 int offensives)
        This function updated the manager formation in the database. It creates the required query and sends it.
        Parameters:
        managerID - the ID of the Manager, that should be updated.
        defenders - the number of defenders
        middfielders - the number of middfielders
        offensives - the number of offensives

      • getPlayerFromResult

        public static Player getPlayerFromResult(java.sql.ResultSet rs)
        This function creates a Player object by the given ResultSet. The ResultSet has to be valid for this!
        Parameters:
        rs - a VALID ResultSet, where all information are set. Otherwise the Player object can be incomplete.
        Returns:
        a new Player object.

      • getPlayersFromResultSet

        public static java.util.List<Player> getPlayersFromResultSet(java.sql.ResultSet rs)
                                                      throws java.sql.SQLException
        This function iterates over the given ResultSet and calls the getPlayerFromResult for each entry.
        Parameters:
        rs - the ResultSet with the Player information
        Returns:
        a List of Player objects.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • getPlayer

        public Player getPlayer(int playerID)
        This method sends a query to the database to collect all information for the Player with the given ID.
        Parameters:
        playerID - the ID of a Player
        Returns:
        the Player object for the given ID from the "Spieler" table of the database.

      • updateManager

        public void updateManager(Manager manager)
        This function updates the SQLEntries for the given Manager.
        Parameters:
        manager - the Manager, that should be updated.

      • copymanagerTeam

        public void copymanagerTeam()
        This function clears the "Manschaft Copy" table and copies the "Mannschaft" table to the "Manschaft Copy" table.
